bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Dispositions of agreements that unduly restrict competition

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 54.1 (a) of the Act, the minister may determine that a disposition of a tree farm licence, forest licence or pulpwood agreement unduly restricts competition in a fibre market if any of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to the fibre distribution zone that includes the agreement area, the HHI would be 1 800 or greater after the disposition and, subject to subsection (2),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the HHI would increase by 100 or more as a result of the disposition, or
the HHI share associated with the intended recipient would be 100 or greater after the disposition;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the HHI share associated with the intended recipient is 100 or greater for a fibre distribution zone adjacent to the fibre distribution zone that includes the agreement area;
in relation to the fibre distribution zone that includes the agreement area,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the estimated annually received timber of the timber processing facilities for which the intended recipient holds an interest is 150 000 m3 or greater, and
the allocated fibre volume/estimated annually acquired timber ratio associated with the intended recipient is 1.0 or greater.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) (a) (ii) does not apply if the HHI for the fibre distribution zone that includes the agreement area would, as a result of the disposition, decrease by an amount equal to or greater than the HHI share associated with the intended recipient for the fibre distribution zone, as calculated after the disposition.
If more than one person is intended to be the recipient of an agreement, the minister may make the determination under subsection (1) as though each person were the only recipient of the agreement.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the intended disposition is from a corporation to an affiliate of the corporation.

change.changenote: Section 12 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 176/2019, effective July 19, 2019.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Corporate changes of control that unduly restrict competition

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 54.5 (1) (b) (ii) of the Act, the minister may determine that a change of control of a corporation that holds a tree farm licence, forest licence or pulpwood agreement unduly restricts competition in a fibre market if any of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to the fibre distribution zone that includes the agreement area, the HHI is 1 800 or greater after the change of control and, subject to subsection (2),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the HHI increases by 100 or more as a result of the change of control, or
the HHI share associated with the corporation is 100 or greater after the change of control;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the HHI share associated with the corporation, after the change of control, is 100 or greater for a fibre distribution zone adjacent to the fibre distribution zone that includes the agreement area;
in relation to the fibre distribution zone that includes the agreement area,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the estimated annually received timber of the timber processing facilities for which the corporation holds an interest is 150 000 m3 or greater after the change of control, and
the allocated fibre volume/estimated annually acquired timber ratio associated with the corporation is 1.0 or greater after the change of control.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) (a) (ii) does not apply if, as a result of the change of control, the HHI for the fibre distribution zone that includes the agreement area decreases by an amount equal to or greater than the HHI share associated with the corporation for the fibre distribution zone, as calculated after the change of control.
